div3.head: PROPOSITION 29.

p.hi: If an odd number by multiplying an odd number make some number, the product will be odd.

div3.p: For let the odd number A by multiplying the odd number B make C; I say that C is odd.
For, since A by multiplying B has made C, C is made up of as many numbers equal to B as there are units in A. [VII. Def. 15]
And each of the numbers A, B is odd; therefore C is made up of odd numbers the multitude of which is odd.
Thus C is odd. [IX. 23] Q. E. D.
